## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 288, 905, 303]]<|/det|>
9709/23  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 312, 309, 328]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 312, 905, 328]]<|/det|>
May/June 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[757, 337, 905, 352]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 367, 395, 383]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 395, 395, 411]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 429, 222, 445]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 868, 648]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 676, 213, 691]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 693, 728, 725]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 92, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[368, 102, 603, 368]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 384, 920, 420]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = 8\mathrm{e}^{- x} - \mathrm{e}^{2x}\) . The curve crosses the \(y\)-axis at the point \(A\) and the \(x\)-axis at the point \(B\). The shaded region is bounded by the curve and the two axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 432, 144, 450]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 431, 430, 450]]<|/det|>
Find the gradient of the curve at \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 432, 920, 450]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 84, 146, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 83, 809, 102]]<|/det|>
Show that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(B\) is \(\ln 2\) and hence find the area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 84, 920, 102]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 81, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 81, 484, 101]]<|/det|>
A curve is defined by the parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[376, 114, 621, 135]]<|/det|>
\[x = 4\cos^2 t,\qquad y = \sqrt{3}\sin 2t,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 157, 406, 177]]<|/det|>
for values of \(t\) such that \(0 < t < \frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 186, 918, 222]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the normal to the curve at the point for which \(t = \frac{1}{6}\pi\). Give your answer in the form \(ax + by + c = 0\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 203, 917, 222]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 85, 94, 104]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 85, 609, 106]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 9x^{3} + 18x^{2} + 5x + 4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 117, 146, 136]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 117, 818, 136]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((3x + 2)\), and show that the remainder is 6.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 117, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 92, 149, 109]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 84, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\int_{0}^{2} \frac{\mathrm{p}(x)}{3x + 2} \mathrm{~d}x\), giving your answer in the form \(a + \ln b\) where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 109, 920, 127]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 92, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[329, 101, 667, 240]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 252, 866, 280]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \frac{\ln(2x + 1)}{x + 3}\). The curve has a maximum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 293, 146, 312]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 288, 368, 313]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 295, 918, 313]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 630, 186, 648]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 630, 751, 655]]<|/det|>
Show that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(M\) satisfies the equation \(x = \frac{x + 3}{\ln(2x + 1)} - 0.5\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 632, 917, 651]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 82, 146, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 82, 725, 101]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(M\) lies between 2.5 and 3.0 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 515, 186, 533]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 515, 920, 549]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula based on the equation in part **(b)** to find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(M\) correct to 4 significant figures. Give the result of each iteration to 6 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 532, 920, 551]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 97, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 82, 146, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 82, 428, 101]]<|/det|>
Prove that \(2 \sin \theta \cosec 2 \theta \equiv \sec \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 918, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 650, 185, 668]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 650, 662, 668]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\tan^2\theta + 7\sin \theta \cosec 2\theta = 8\) for \(-\pi < \theta < \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 644, 918, 663]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 114, 920, 147]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
